sermons.title: Divine Healing

I met some saintsâ€”not anybody thatâ€™s here; now, donâ€™t feel bad; Iâ€™m not pointing right at you, see: somebody elseâ€”but saints.  I was praying for the sick, and talking faith, and praying faith, and God was there.  And these saints talked unbelief. Youâ€™d be surprised how much unbelief is hanging on us.  The Bible talks about â€œthe sin that doth so easily beset us.â€  It sticks to us.  Die klebt uns an.  Grad wie die Kletten; das ist Unglaube.  Itâ€™s unbelief.  And youâ€™d be surprised what mountains of unbelief there are in the saints.  You donâ€™t find it out until the cat bites them, or a dog barks at them, or something else happens and they really have to believe God.  Why, then their faith is goneâ€”absolutely gone.
